DataElement.preferredName: Edmonton Symptom Assessment System-Sarcoma Modified  Current Assessment Best Ability to Move Normally To Worst Possible Ability to Move Normally Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A persons' stated observation of their current ability to move normally using a 11 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edmonton Symptom Assessment System-Sarcoma Modified  Current Assessment Best Ability to Move Normally To Worst Possible Ability to Move Normally Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor for which a distinct line of differentiation cannot be determined. This term may be used for small biopsy specimens for which adequate tissue is not present for definitive classification._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Having the most positive qualities._The quality of being able to change positions within regular limits._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._To the highest degree of inferiority or badness; the least favorable outcome._Capable of happening or occurring._The quality of being able to change positions within regular limits._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Sarcoma Change Edmonton Symptom Assessment System
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor for which a distinct line of differentiation cannot be determined. This term may be used for small biopsy specimens for which adequate tissue is not present for definitive classification.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care.

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm of the soft tissue or bone. It arises from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels. Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Symptom Severity Range Integer::11 Point Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
